dmca.title: [TP-C320338Q] Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures
dmca.body:
-----Original Message----- From: abuse@theplanet.com [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] Posted At: Monday, July 31, 2006 11:57 AM Posted To: Copyright Conversation: [TP-C320338Q] Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures Subject: [TP-C320338Q] Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures From: abuse@theplanet.com Subject: [TP-C320338Q] Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures Reference: [TP-C320338Q] For your review. Thank you, Policy Enforcement The Planet Internet Services, Inc. http://www.theplanet.com/legal/ ==== Original Message ==== 1. Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures Added by system at Monday, Jul 31 2006 02:34 pm X-MailFrom: Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org X-RcptTo: abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com Received: from [172.16.214.180] by [10.5.0.64] (abacus) for ; Mon Jul 31 14:34:53 2006 Return-path: Delivery-date: Mon, 31 Jul 2006 14:34:52 -0500 Received: from smtp01.theplanet.com ([70.87.6.110]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org) with esmtp (Exim) id 1G7dXQ-00030M-8O for abuse@abacus.inside.theplanet.com; Mon, 31 Jul 2006 14:34:52 -0500 Received: from mail.theplanet.com ([216.185.111.52]) by smtp01.theplanet.com with Microsoft SMTPSVC(6.0.3790.1830); Mon, 31 Jul 2006 14:34:51 -0500 Received: from mx01.inside.filter.theplanet.com ([172.16.214.180] helo=mx01.filter.theplanet.com) by mail.theplanet.com (envelope-from Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org) with esmtps (TLSv1:DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA:256) (Exim) id 1G7dXP-0004M2-GO; Mon, 31 Jul 2006 14:34:51 -0500 Received: from keys.mpaa.org ([66.252.128.54]) by mx01.filter.theplanet.com (envelope-from Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org) with esmtp (Exim) id 1G7dXP-0002zS-0H; Mon, 31 Jul 2006 14:34:51 -0500 Received: from keys.mpaa.org (localhost.localdomain [127.0.0.1]) by keys.mpaa.org (PGP Universal) with ESMTP id 5579D2F35DE; Mon, 31 Jul 2006 12:34:48 -0700 (PDT) Received: from mailgate.mpaa.org ([192.168.90.25]) by keys.mpaa.org (PGP Universal service); Mon, 31 Jul 2006 12:34:48 -0700 X-PGP-Universal: processed; by keys.mpaa.org on Mon, 31 Jul 2006 12:34:48 -0700 Received: from LAMAIL2.mpaa.org ([192.168.100.241]) by mailgate.mpaa.org with Microsoft SMTPSVC(5.0.2195.7035); Mon, 31 Jul 2006 12:34:48 -0700 Content-class: urn:content-classes:message MIME-Version: 1.0 Content-Type: multipart/mixed; boundary="----_=_NextPart_001_01C6B4D8.61E72B79" Subject: Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures X-MimeOLE: Produced By Microsoft Exchange V6.5 Date: Mon, 31 Jul 2006 12:34:47 -0700 Message-ID: X-MS-Has-Attach: yes X-MS-TNEF-Correlator: Thread-Topic: Unauthorized use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures Thread-Index: Aca02GIByybWv0F3Snq1x0UP00oNYg== From: To: Cc: X-OriginalArrivalTime: 31 Jul 2006 19:34:48.0136 (UTC) FILETIME=[62467C80:01C6B4D8] Received-SPF: none (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 66.252.128.54 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of mpaa.org) client-ip=66.252.128.54; envelope-from=Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org; helo=keys.mpaa.org; Received-SPF: none (mx01.filter.theplanet.com: 70.87.6.110 is neither permitted nor denied by domain of mpaa.org) client-ip=70.87.6.110; envelope-from=Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org; helo=smtp01.theplanet.com; (multipart/mixed) Multipart prefix (text/plain) This is a multi-part message in MIME format. (multipart/alternative) MIME element (text/plain) MOTION PICTURE ASSOCIATION OF AMERICA, INC. 15503 VENTURA BOULEVARD ENCINO, CALIFORNIA 91436 UNITED STATES Anti-Piracy Operations PHONE: (818) 728 - 8127 Email: antipiracy@copyright.org July 31, 2006 Name: General Counsel ISP: ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. (ThePlanet.com) Via Fax/Email RE: Unauthorized Use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures Reference#: The Planet-10000 (M) IP Address: 69.93.90.72 http://www.scifiboxsets.com Date of Infringement: July 31, 2006 Dear General Counsel: The Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) represents the following motion picture production and distribution companies: Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc. Disney Enterprises, Inc. Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios Inc. Paramount Pictures Corporation TriStar Pictures, Inc. Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation United Artists Pictures, Inc. United Artists Corporation Universal City Studios, LLLP Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. We have received information that, on the above noted date, the IP address 69.93.90.72 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com) was used to sell or to materially contribute to the selling of DVD copies of copyrighted motion pictures. The title(s) offered included, but were not limited to: 24 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=94) The A-Team (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=311) Airwolf (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=317) Alias (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=191) Babylon 5 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=193) Dark Angel (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=131) Family Guy (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=194) Lost (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=302) Roswell (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=208) Star Trek Enterprise (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=236) The X-Files (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&products_ id=206) We believe this information should prove sufficient for you to locate the material complained about herein; however, please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions or clarification requests you may have. The unauthorized distribution or public performance of copyrighted motion pictures constitutes copyright infringement under the Copyright Act, Title 17 United States Code Section 106(3)-(4). This conduct may also violate the laws of other countries, international law, and/or treaty obligations. As the owner of this IP address, we request that you immediately do the following: 1. Notify the end user of the infringement(s). 2. Remove or disable access to the material identified above. 3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement. On behalf of the respective owners of the exclusive rights to the copyrighted material at issue in this notice, we hereby state, pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, Title 17 United States Code Section 512, that the information in this notification is accurate and that we have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owners, their respective agents, or the law. Also pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, we hereby state, under penalty of perjury, that we are authorized to act on behalf of the owners of the exclusive rights being infringed as set forth in this notification. Please contact us at the above listed address or by replying to this email should you have any questions. Kindly include the above noted Reference # in the subject line of all email correspondence. We thank you for your cooperation in this matter. Your prompt response is requested. Respectfully, Motion Picture Association of America Richard Rosner U.S. Anti-Piracy Internet Enforcement Motion Picture Association Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org 818-995-6600 x 325 MIME element (text/html)

MOTION PICTURE ASSOCIATION OF AMERICA, INC.

15503 VENTURA BOULEVARD

ENCINO, CALIFORNIA 91436

UNITED STATES

 

Anti-Piracy Operations

PHONE: (818) 728 - 8127

Email: antipiracy@copyright.org <mailto:antipiracy@copyright.org>

 

July 31, 2006

 

Name:   General Counsel

ISP:      ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc. (ThePlanet.com)

 

Via Fax/Email

 

RE:        &n bsp;           &n bsp;           &n bsp;          Unauthorized Use of Copyrighted Motion Pictures

Reference#:                                 The Planet-10000 (M)

IP Address:          &nbs p;           &nbs p;        69.93.90.72  http://www.scifiboxsets.com

Date of Infringement:                   July 31, 2006

 

 

 

Dear General Counsel:

 

The Motion Picture Association of America (MPAA) represents the following motion picture production and distribution companies:

 

Columbia Pictures Industries, Inc.

Disney Enterprises, Inc.

Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios Inc.

Paramount Pictures Corporation

TriStar Pictures, Inc.

Twentieth Century Fox Film Corporation

United Artists Pictures, Inc.

United Artists Corporation

Universal City Studios, LLLP

Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc.

 

We have received information that, on the above noted date, the IP address 69.93.90.72 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com) was used to sell or to materially contribute to the selling of DVD copies of copyrighted motion pictures.  The title(s) offered included, but were not limited to:

 

24 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=94)

The A-Team (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=311)

Airwolf (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=317)

Alias (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=191)

Babylon 5 (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=193)

Dark Angel (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=131)

Family Guy (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=194)

Lost (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=302)

Roswell (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=208)

Star Trek Enterprise (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=236)

The X-Files (http://www.scifiboxsets.com/catalog/product_info.php?cPath=25&produ cts_id=206)

 

 

We believe this information should prove sufficient for you to locate the material complained about herein; however, please don't hesitate to contact us with any questions or clarification requests you may have.

 

The unauthorized distribution or public performance of copyrighted motion pictures constitutes copyright infringement under the Copyright Act, Title 17 United States Code Section 106(3)-(4). This conduct may also violate the laws of other countries, international law, and/or treaty obligations.

 

As the owner of this IP address, we request that you immediately do the following:

 

1. Notify the end user of the infringement(s).

2. Remove or disable access to the material identified above.

3. Take appropriate action against the account holder under your Abuse Policy/Terms of Service Agreement.

 

On behalf of the respective owners of the exclusive rights to the copyrighted material at issue in this notice, we hereby state, pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, Title 17 United States Code Section 512, that the information in this notification is accurate and that we have a good faith belief that use of the material in the manner complained of is not authorized by the copyright owners, their respective agents, or the law.

 

Also pursuant to the Digital Millennium Copyright Act, we hereby state, under penalty of perjury, that we are authorized to act on behalf of the owners of the exclusive rights being infringed as set forth in this notification.

 

Please contact us at the above listed address or by replying to this email should you have any questions.  Kindly include the above noted Reference # in the subject line of all email correspondence.

 

We thank you for your cooperation in this matter.  Your prompt response is requested.

 

Respectfully,

 

Motion Picture Association of America

 

 

Richard Rosner

U.S. Anti-Piracy Internet Enforcement

Motion Picture Association

Richard_Rosner@mpaa.org

818-995-6600 x 325
